Key Match Events: The Spurs forged a 12-2 run capped by a pair of free throws from Branham at the 1:46 mark.
Wembanyama made a 3-pointer with 29 seconds remaining in the first quarter.
Ayton led all scorers with 17 points before halftime.
Ayton banked in a hook shot with 7:26 to play in the second quarter.
Ayton tied the game on an alley-oop dunk with 1:12 left in the second period before the Spurs took a 56-55 lead into the break.
Post-Match Reflections: The Spurs snapped a two-game losing streak.
Eight players scored in double figures for San Antonio.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Deandre Ayton and Jerami Grant led the Trail Blazers with 21 points apiece.
Anfernee Simons added 19 points and seven assists, Shaedon Sharpe had 13 points and Scoot Henderson 11 for Portland.
Others: The Spurs used an uber-balanced attack to defeat the visiting Portland Trail Blazers 118-105 in the NBA on Thursday.
The Spurs were playing the second game of a road-home back-to-back and beginning a five-game homestand.
